programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Pups Save a Giant Plant: The PAW Patrol are driving the PAW Patroller into the jungle to visit Carlos and Tracker, along with Mayor Goodway and Chickaletta. Mayor Goodway is going to present a gift to say hello. And, the gift is a green plant named Buddy, as Mayor Goodway raised him from a seedling in their garden. As the PAW Patrol arrive, they'd park near a swamp where Carlos and Tracker are waiting. They all greet each other and Mayor Goodway presents Buddy to Carlos, who says the jungle has lots of super rich soil, rain, and sunlight for the plants to grow healthy. Mayor Goodway plants Buddy near the swamp with some help from Rubble, and declares Buddy to be a symbol of friendship on going. Then, Buddy begins to grow bigger. Tracker hears some animals moving in the jungle,and he can hear baby snakes hissing. Everyone leaves to see them, but Mayor Goodway, Chickaletta, and Marshall want to stay behind. As everyone leaves, Buddy grows more and more bigger, and lifts Mayor Goodway and Chickaletta. As Marshall sees what happened, he tries to help her down, but he can't. For everyone else, they are watching baby snakes playing right after they hatched from their eggs. Ryder gets Mayor Goodway's call about Buddy growing taller and lifting her and Chickaletta off the ground. Ryder says they're on their way and summons the pups to the PAW Patroller. As everyone is ready, Ryder tells them about Buddy growing too big and Mayor Goodway and Chickaletta getting stuck on his leaf. Ryder assigns Marshall to use his fire truck ladder to help Mayor Goodway climb down, and Chase to set up his net just for backup. As they get ready for the mission, Ryder, Marshall, and Chase hop into their vehicles and drive off to save Mayor Goodway and Chickaletta. As the PAW Patrol made it to Buddy, Chase puts up his net between Marshall's fire truck and Buddy, and Marshall puts up his ladder for Mayor Goodway to climb down. But, Mayor Goodway isn't able to move because Buddy's vines has grown around her ankles. Ryder asks Tracker to use his cables to climb up Buddy and use his pliers to cut the vine to free Mayor Goodway. Tracker climbs up the plant with his cables and frees Mayor Goodway. Buddy opens his mouth and gets Chickaletta trapped inside. Mayor Goodway falls off of Buddy's leaf and lands on Chase's net. Carlos reads a book and discovers what kind of plant Bubby is. Buddy is a Buggum-Lovus, a type of plant that eats insects. The insects are on the other side of the swamp, the reason why Buddy shouldn't be planted on the side Ryder and Carlos are standing, and how Buddy grew too big is because the soil is too fertile. And if Buddy doesn't eat insects soon, he will become ill. Ryder comes up with an idea: if they could bring insects to Buddy, Buddy will open up his mouth to eat them and release Chickaletta. Ryder calls Zuma to come and see him. As Zuma arrives, Ryder adds a pup-treat on a stick and put it on Zuma's hovercraft. Zuma needs to use the bait to bring the insects to Buddy. As Zuma takes off to get the bugs, Ryder comes up with another part of his idea: he calls Rubble to bring his rig to help bring Buddy to where he belongs. As Zuma arrives with with a big bunch of insects, Ryder asks Chase to use his launcher to lure the bait up to Buddy. Chase activates his launcher and Ryder puts the bait inside. The bait lures the insects to Buddy. And as Buddy's mouth begins to open to eat the bugs, Chickaletta gets out and lands on Chase's net. Now that Chickaletta is free, Rubble digs out Buddy's roots, pulls him out of the ground, and places him on top of the PAW Patroller. Then, the PAW Patrol drive Buddy to the other side of the swamp. As Buddy is planted to where he belongs, Mayor Goodway thanks the PAW Patrol for saving her and Chickaletta, and replanting Buddy to his new home. And Ryder says "Whenever you have a plant problem, just yelp for help" and gives the pups some treats. And, the story ends with Buddy eating one more bunch of insects. Pups Get Stuck: The story begins with Marshall, Rubble, and Rocky cleaning up the beach which has lots of trash on it from a big storm last night. Rubble is carrying a magnetic device with the claw arm of his bulldozer called "The Electro-Magnet" to clean up the metal junk. As the magnetic device magnetizes some metal junk, a crab becomes frightened by this, and takes shelter in a metal bucket which also becomes magnetized. Rocky then questions Rubble about how to remove the junk off the magnetic device. Rubble then shows him by pressing a button inside the bulldozer which turns off the Electro-Magnet, and makes all the metal junk fall off. As the crab walks away holding the bucket. Marshall then questions him how he did that, and Rubble shows him by pressing the button to make the magnetic device turn on and off. Then he repeatedly does it. Rocky then requests Rubble to put the junk inside his recycling truck. Rubble then does so. As that happens, Marshall notices a weather vane which belongs to Farmer Yumi. When suddenly, it becomes magnetized by Rubble's Electro-Magnet. Marshall tries to get it, but when he jumps onto the metal junk, he is spun around, and thrown off along with the weather vane. As Marshall lands, he hits a metal barrel, causing it to land in front of Rubble, and his crane arm to swing around, and throws everything off of it. The Electro-Magnet lands on Marshall's fire engine as well. Meanwhile, back at the Lookout, Ryder is filing Robo-Dog's wheels, when Rubble calls him about the misplaced weather vane, then Ryder tells him that he'll meet the pups at Farmer Yumi's farm. and he also thanks Rubble for cleaning up the beach. After that, Marshall and Rocky jump into their vehicles and drive off to the farm, but Marshall runs over a twig on the road, causing the Electro-Magnet which fell in his truck earlier, to turn on. Because of this, he magnetizes a metal waste bin, and the crab with the bucket from before. Then, Marshall hears a rattling sound which is possibly the junk he magnetized and thinks it's the junk inside Rocky's truck. Then Rocky suggests to change his name to "Clunky". Then, the PAW Patrol continue driving, but the Electro-Magnet magnetizes some more things. He magnetizes a clown's unicycle and some nails from a fence. Then, they drive by a train track, but the Electro-Magnet causes it to fall apart. Because of this, Mr. Hudson's train crashes, and he drops his phone onto a tree branch. And the branch is also blocking the door. Meanwhile, at Farmer Yumi's farm, Chickaletta is pecking on some corn which Mayor Goodway says that Chickaletta really likes. Farmer Yumi decides to get some more corn. As she walks away, Marshall, Rocky, and Ryder arrive at the farm. Rocky returns the weather vane to Farmer Yumi. Then, Marshall uses his ladder to help Rocky put it back onto the top of the barn. But, then the magnetic device magnetizes the weather vane. Then Rocky notices all the metal junk Marshall's truck magnetized on the way to the farm. Then, it magnetizes a metal bucket which Farmer Yumi was holding, and a wrench which Ryder found in Rocky's truck. Ryder then finds out Marshall's fire truck is magnetic. Marshall wonders why it's magnetized, but him, nor Ryder know. Then, Ryder calls out to Rocky to put the weather vane back on top of the barn. But the weather vane is stuck to the truck, and is too heavy for Ryder to pull on his own. Then, Marshall and Rocky help out, and they succeed, and the weather vane falls into some corn. Chickaletta comes to it because she thought the weather vane's rooster was real. She pecks on some corn which was on the weather vane's rooster's tail feathers. Ryder then takes it and hands it to Rocky to put back on the barn. Rocky then climbs up Marshall's ladder and secures it back on with his ratchet. As this happens, Chickaletta follows him up to the barn. Meanwhile, Mr. Hudson who is still stuck, uses a twig to touch his phone, and call Ryder. Mr. Hudson explains about the incident, and Ryder summons the other pups to the Lookout. After that, Marshall drives back to the Lookout, but he magnetizes Bettina's cowbell, causing her to become really upset. When they get the Lookout, Marshall's pup tag becomes magnetized to his truck. As that happens, the Electro-Magnet is turned off causing everything to fall off of Marshall's truck. Then, Marshall flies off the truck, and lands on the unicycle. He rides around on it, and crashes into the other pups inside the elevator. Once they get to the top, Ryder gives the pups their orders: Rubble is told to lift the train with his crane arm, Rocky is told to use his hammer to secure the broken rails, and Marshall is told to use his ladder to help Mr. Hudson get out of the window. When they get there, Marshall helps Mr. Hudson get out of the window of the train with his ladder, and brings him down to safety. Ryder then tells Rubble to lift the train with his crane arm, Rubble then does so. Then, Rocky is told to secure the rails onto the ground. After the job is done, Ryder tells the pups that it's time to go home, but as Marshall is driving, the Electro-Magnet gets turned on, causing firetruck becomes magnetized to the train. Rubble tries to help, but his bulldozer becomes stuck to Marshall's firetruck. Rocky offers to help, but he gets stuck too. Ryder then questions Rubble about what happened to the Electro-Magnet, but Rubble doesn't know. Then they start jumping to conclusions, when Marshall is questioned if he has it. He turns around, and finds it underneath, his firetruck's ladder. Ryder turns it off causing all the pups' vehicles to become unstuck. Ryder then informs Marshall that the Electro-Magnet was in his truck all along. Then Marshall notices that it's red just like his firetruck, which made it hard to see. Then, Mayor Goodway calls Ryder to come back to the farm because Chickaletta is stuck on top of the weather vane on the barn's roof. So the pups and Ryder head back to the farm. But by the time they get there, the weather vane falls off the barn's roof, and into a well. Ryder then tells Marshall to use the Electro-Magnet, but Marshall worries that it has caused too many problems. But, Ryder informs him that it will solve the problem. Then, Rubble carries the magnetic device with his crane arm. He turns on the device, and lowers his crane down. It succeeds to catch Chickaletta and the weather vane. Mayor Goodway promises Chickaletta that she'll never lonely, when Rocky hands her a hat shaped like a chicken so Chickaletta can have a pretend friend. Ryder thanks Rocky for giving Chickaletta the pretend chicken as a friend, and Chickaletta squawks ending the story

programme.desc: The children play a game of superheroes, but Strawberry takes her villain role a bit too far, meaning Elf Man and Fairy Girl must save the day

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.desc: On a cold day, the Sunny Bunnies have to wear warm clothing. However, it's impossible to make the boys wear hats and scarves. And so then Shiny and Iris have to deal with the consequences

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence

programme.title: Build a New Life in the Country
programme.desc: George Clarke meets a couple who have left behind their well-paid careers in Aberdeen's oil industry to renovate a chateau in France's Loire Valley. The pair hope to transform it into a luxurious B&B, as well as a home for themselves

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Australian soap opera charting the latest comings and goings of the residents of Summer Bay

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Australian soap opera, charting the lives and loves of the residents of the suburb of Erinsborough

programme.title: A Killer in My Home
programme.desc: A woman is shocked when her husband confesses on his deathbed to having a second family. Six months later, his other wife and her teenage son turn up on her doorstep, determined to be a part of her life - and willing to go to murderous lengths to get what they want. Thriller, starring Bree Williamson and Hannah Vandenbygaart

programme.title: Filthy House SOS
programme.desc: Jon and Brennan come to the aid of an emergency services worker in Bolton, whose got behind on her housework when she began looking after her mother, who has dementia

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Australian soap opera, charting the lives and loves of the residents of the suburb of Erinsborough

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts as Victoria Phoenix try their luck against the Eggheads to win the rolling prize fund

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles gets his hands on a speaker which is powered by water, and Georgie shares a rundown of five gadgets designed to help save money and protect the environment. Elsewhere, Jon and Ortis go head-to-head with two pieces of tech that have been around for over 30 years

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The knife-crime team are faced with the growing threat of mamba, a synthetic cannabis substitute that can be laced with rat poison and alloy-wheel cleaner and has been connected to multiple fatalities in Nottinghamshire. Elsewhere, a pair of opportunistic burglars help themselves to a few bottles from a pub

programme.title: Deadline
programme.desc: Natalie tells James that she has just seen her supposedly dead brother, Oliver, who went on the run after borrowing from drug dealers in Budapest. Determined to uncover the truth, James heads to Budapest, but he is not alone. Drama, starring James D'Arcy and Charlie Murphy

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: The 2002 murder of 87-year-old pensioner Gladys Godfrey in Mansfield, where forensic teams acquired a DNA sample from the killer, but found he was not in the national database

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: A South Wales officer is bitten on the finger while trying to make an arrest, while new policewoman finds herself separated from her colleague and facing an angry young man - who decides to attack her. In south London, two Metropolitan Police officers respond to a 999 call and PC Gray climbs into a dark room through a broken window and soon finds himself facing a man who is armed with a shovel

programme.title: Inside the Force: 24/7
programme.desc: The return of the documentary going behind the scenes at a police station, showing what life is really like for the officers and staff at South Park in Lincoln. Officers are called to a fight at funeral and as Sgt Mike Templeman and PC Will Cawte drive to the incident, an agitated man runs out in front of them and jumps on their car. After being Tasered and arrested and brought back to custody, 22-year-old Declan Grant is charged with a public order offence. Four weeks later, the same man is the main suspect in a murder investigation

programme.title: The 21.co.uk Live Casino Show

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Now That's Funny!

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to Teresa and Nigel Parfitt, the would-be sellers of a two-bedroom semi in Cradley Heath in the heart of the Black Country. programme.title: Falklands War: The Forgotten Battle
programme.desc: Ben Fogle uncovers one of the untold stories of the Falklands - that of the small garrison of British Marines stationed on the Islands when Argentina invaded 40 years ago - and the battle they fought against near-impossible odds. Fogle hears from veterans of Naval Party 8901 who, with fewer than 70 lightly armed men, were left to face an Argentine invading force some ten times that number. With new revelations from recently declassified documents, he travels to the Falklands to ask why they were given virtually no prior warning of the invasion and hears how, four decades after media reports of British 'surrender', the men of Naval Party 8901 want the true story of this forgotten battle to come out

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport

They're expecting more than 81 million passengers to fly in and out of the UK's favourite gateway, with its 76,000 staff ready to take on whatever is thrown at them, and they do it all with a smile on their face. This is Heathrow before lockdown, where the Police are on the front line to protect Heathrow. Officers Terry and Dave return

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Paula, who's 84, has been referred to St George's by her GP for urgent treatment. A routine blood test has detected that Paula has a dangerously high level of potassium, or salts, in her blood

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors have to deal with a nine-year-old Robert whose heart rate is dangerously high. A 32-year-old Mark may have damaged his spine after falling from scaffolding, and a 74-year-old Christine arrives in A&E after an accident in her garden

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Father Ted receives word that the Holy Stone of Clonrichert, Craggy Island's most popular religious knick-knack, is to be upgraded to a Class II relic. Three bishops arrive on the island to perform the solemn ceremony and Father Ted is determined that Father Dougal and Father Jack be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole, Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo travel across the UK to find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. This episode features an Austrian moped

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team trace the relatives of a South London woman and are misled by a trail of false clues, and family trees reveals the life of British soldiers in 19th-century India and early surf tourism

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It's the final day and the bed and breakfast owners are meeting to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. After bitter rebukes and apologies, the winner is finally announced

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head for Crewe to meet rock and roller Billy, who lives in a house that is frozen in time in the 1950s

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz are challenged to take on probably their most obscure car to date - a little known Cannon trials competition car

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Laying electrical cable proves tricky at Dick and Angel's chateau. New chateau owners Donna and Paul move into their new home, but struggle with the language. Edward and Anna face an uphill battle to finish everything before their first wedding

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: A steam engine enthusiast embarks on an ambitious journey across Devon in an 80-year-old steamroller and near Falmouth, two champion free divers explore a spectacular underwater cave

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: The demand for dogs has risen sharply in the UK in 2020, so the staff at Wood Green, the Charity, work hard to match homeless dogs with new owners. They hope loved-up Ryan and Katie fall for Kevin the French bulldog [(123193)]

programme.title: Bruce Springsteen: In His Own Words
programme.desc: With home video from his youth, and footage from his early years performing solo in Greenwich Village, providing unique insight into the life and career of the singer-songwriter, Bruce Springsteen

programme.desc: Cameras follow Lake Winnebago fishermen on an annual 16-day spear-hunting expedition in search of giant lake sturgeon

programme.desc: Learn how animals use all sorts of strategies to protect their families and food from marauders

programme.title: Heliopolis: The City of the Sun
programme.desc: In Cairo, a German-Egyptian team is searching for traces of the largest temple of the Pharaohs, seeking answers as to why the sanctuary was abandoned more than 2000 years ago. Today, only an obelisk testifies to the former splendour of the sanctuary

programme.title: The Secret of the Animal Mummies
programme.desc: Following archaeologist Mélanie Flossmann-Schütze's investigation into one of ancient Egypt's last unsolved mysteries, the circumstances surrounding animal sacrifice rituals of the period

programme.title: Beautiful Serengeti

programme.title: Egypt's Lost Cities
programme.desc: It is possible that only one percent of the wonders of Ancient Egypt have been discovered, but now, thanks to a pioneering approach to archaeology, that is about to change. Dr Sarah Parcak uses satellites to probe beneath the sands, where she has found cities, temples and pyramids. Now, with Dallas Campbell and Liz Bonnin, she heads to Egypt to discover if these magnificent buildings are really there

programme.title: The Last Day of World War One
programme.desc: Michael Palin visits the places where numerous soldiers died in the final hours of World War I, many after the Armistice had been signed

programme.title: WWI: The Final Hours
programme.desc: On 8th November 1918, an Englishman, a Frenchman and a German gathered in secret, on a train carriage in a forest near Paris. Their meeting would last for three days. Its aim: bring peace to Europe, and an end to four long years of brutal war

programme.title: Shooting the War
programme.desc: How WW2 was documented by German and British home movie makers. This part features the amateur films of four fighting men: Britons Derek Brown and Leslie Fowler and Germans Paul Kellermann and Klaus Eismann

programme.title: Shooting the War
programme.desc: This part is about the experience of children during the war, seen through the films of them shot by parents, friends and teachers, which capture the novelty of war but also the reality of death and loss. Eric Powell filmed the arrival of young evacuee Marion as she became part of his family, while Rainer and Wolfgang Fritz recall how their father filmed the building of the community air raid shelter

programme.title: Shooting the War
programme.desc: In Germany, Elisabeth Wilms filmed everyday life of women in her home city of Dortmund and in Britain, Rosie Newman was doing much the same. Jean Riesco's father filmed Jean's life as she became a woman at the start of the war, while others joined the war effort, including Anne Richmond who joined the Land Army, and Iris Watts who made armaments

programme.title: DNA Caillte
programme.desc: Exploring how DNA research is revealing the truth about Ireland's early inhabitants. Some 10,000 years ago, dark-skinned, blue-eyed people roamed prehistoric Irish forests. Thousands of years later, they were replaced by a new wave of settlers that introduced a dynamic new technology: farming. Dr Lara Cassidy of Trinity College Dublin has uncovered a shocking secret about a man who was buried at the centre of Newgrange, our most sacred ancient monument

programme.title: DNA Caillte
programme.desc: Exploring a critical time in Irish history: the move from paganism to Christianity. Medieval records don't give much information on the lives of ordinary people, but now DNA and other scientific techniques are opening fascinating windows into the past. Evidence from burial sites in Ireland show that ancient pre-Christian beliefs continued long into the Christian era, and a shocking discovery in County Roscommon suggests that some feared the rise of undead creatures

programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Nikki Fox, Robert Rinder and Georgia Taylor `see it and say it\" as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Alan Partridge (Steve Coogan) is in the Star Guest announcer booth, and George Ezra performs Anyone For You in a stunning End of the Show Show. Stephen Mulhern has a big surprise up his sleeve for some unsuspecting celebrities

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Olly Murs hosts as the six heat winners battle it out for the £50,000 prize, each taking to the stage on their own in the guise of their idol to sing one of their hits. Panellists Adam Lambert, Sheridan Smith, Beverley Knight and Jason Manford are on hand to offer words of support and congratulate each finalist, before the voting audience pick the winner

programme.title: Paul Sinha's TV Showdown
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Sarah Hadland, Ed Byrne and Jamie Laing join team captains Fay Ripley and Rob Beckett on the comedy quiz show, as The Chaser expert and stand-up comedian Paul Sinha tests the panellists' TV knowledge

programme.title: Lucy (2014)
programme.desc: Action adventure directed by Luc Besson, starring Scarlett Johansson and Morgan Freeman. Lucy, an American student in Taiwan, is persuaded by her new boyfriend to take a briefcase to the hotel room of a Mr Jang. But Jang is really a vicious crime boss, who forces Lucy to become a mule for an experimental drug that's bagged up and hidden inside her abdomen. However, when the bag leaks, Lucy undergoes a transformation of mind-blowing proportions..

programme.title: Starstruck

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Alphabetical
programme.desc: Quiz in which three new contestants take on the reigning champion, answering questions based around letters of the alphabet. Their aim is to win a jackpot that increases in size each time it is not won. Hosted by Jeff Stelling

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave makes a Gareth-shaped piñata for Gareth's birthday, but his starfish friend is unfamiliar with such an item and confused when the Spuds bash it to pieces. Convinced that Dave does not like her anymore, Gareth leaves and heads back out to sea - can Dave find her in time and persuade her that it was all a silly misunderstanding?

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. School puts Dave on a work placement with his dad at the local dump - sucked into the mysterious world of rubbish, an old cow and a group of unruly fridges teach Dave an important lesson about recycling

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Lil Sue asks Dave to 'pet sit' her flea Mr Grumps - when Fuzzypeg, the Spud family dog, eats the little fella, Dave must launch a rescue mission. Will he and the rest of the Spuds reach Mr Grumps before he is dissolved like food inside Fuzzypeg's tummy?

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur

programme.title: Dare Master @Home
programme.desc: Whoopie cushions, eggs and paper planes await Dare Master Danny and his challengers as they take on more dares which you can try at home

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Animated comedy series following the comical efforts of Mike the pug as he tries to date his neighbour's dog. Mike wants to impress Iris with a special sushi dinner, but everything goes to pot when the raccoons break in

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike gets Iris a beautiful bouquet of flowers, only to discover that she has a terrible allergy to them

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Animated comedy series following the comical efforts of Mike the pug as he tries to date his neighbour's dog. Mike decides that the best way to impress Iris is to sing her a romantic song, but Mercury and Fluffy have different ideas

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Polorizing Plight of the Perilous Poopetrators
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. In a final attempt to save their summer, George and Harold convince Cash Networth from Camp Upper Crust to buy their camp and fire Krupp on the condition that they put on a great talent show. The boys mobilise the campers to perform an incredible show - meanwhile, Melvin plots to sabotage the show by turning the kids into real villains..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The clumsy hero is kept awake by the deafening sound of roadworks outside his bedroom window, but a plot to restore peace by feeding the workmen goes spectacularly wrong

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The clumsy hero sets out to replace his worn-out sofa, but finds he does not have enough cash for a new one

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. It's bedtime, and Dave has eaten a cheesecake that was not meant for him - finding himself stuck inside a cheesy dream with the rest of the Spuds, the only way to escape is to admit what he has done and confront his cheesy guilt

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Anna and Dave are building a toy sloth from the parts given away free with every Bran Cran Krustee cereal box - when finally complete, their toy ends up bigger than Grimsby Heights, and Dave and Anna must find a way to keep it under control

programme.title: Don't Unleash the Beast
programme.desc: Game show. Team Firecrackers enter the ancient underground world of Halian - can they overcome the obstacles, retrieve the ancient artefacts and escape, or will they be eaten alive by the terrifying Beast?

programme.title: The Pier
programme.desc: Following the highs and lows of life on Llandudno Pier during the summer of 2021, as life began again in this Victorian seaside gem. The series features the men and women who keep so many of the seaside traditions alive - the stall keepers, food vendors, entertainers, boatmen and hoteliers who combine to make a day at the Welsh seaside such an experience

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Singer Petula Clark talks about her long career, actress Fiona Dolman discusses Midsomer Murders, and former NHS doctor-turned-comedian and author Adam Kay chats about the power of laughter. Plus, a look the ancient art of horseback falconry, and the best in British chardonnay

programme.title: The Pet Show
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary and Joanna Page celebrate the UK's love of animals, with Loose Women's Nadia Sawalha and her dog tackling the agility course in Ready, Pet, Go. programme.title: The Masked Singer US

programme.desc: Joel McHale joins the panel as a guest judge as Popcorn, Giraffe, Snow Owls and Sun take to the stage, before one of them is unmasked

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is discovered bound to a tree, doused in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads DCI Barnaby to tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron at the upmarket Wyvern House restaurant. However, secrets from the past surface after the murderer strikes again, and the repercussions are felt further than they were originally intended. With Neil Dudgeon, Neil McCaul, Sharon Small, Marc Elliott and Arabella Weir

programme.desc: Comedy fantasy sequel starring Steve Carell and Morgan Freeman. programme.desc: Wedding planner Claire has a long list of requirements for her dress. Lillian wants a slinky style but her sister is pushing her to choose a princess gown

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress UK
programme.desc: Bride Kayleigh wants a light, flowing dress with sparkle for her wedding in Mexico, and Karen seeks a baby pink frock for her pink-themed wedding in Cyprus

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress UK
programme.desc: Michelle wants a timeless dress for her wedding at St Paul's Cathedral; drama queen Lois seeks a theatrical style; Gemma wants a sexy dress for her exotic beach wedding, but her friends are set on a princess style

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress UK

programme.title: Say Yes To The Dress: Lancashire
programme.desc: Lindsay has rejected 30 dresses and has zero body confidence, so when Gok finds three perfect frocks she has a dilemma. Meanwhile, Steph is four feet tall and wants a sexy gown for her wedding

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride Lindsey is having a magical woodland wedding and wants a themed dress to match. Jo and Al help military bride Rebecca find a confidence-boosting gown

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A country girl is looking for a gown with bling; A socialite needs an extravagant dress for her royal Kentucky wedding and a vintage Randy dress emerges

programme.title: Extreme Couponing

programme.title: Extreme Couponing

programme.title: Nate & Jeremiah by Design
programme.desc: Brandy and Steve are novices to renovating; they attempt some very simple renovations but fail miserably; worried she's losing her home, Nate and Jeremiah must help them create a home where they can spend family time together and create memories

programme.title: Good Bones

programme.sub-title: This Land is Your Land...or Hers
